title: Amazon Prime Price Increase: Here’s Why It’s Still Worth It
sub_head: A Prime membership will now cost you $20 more a year. Here’s how it stacks up to the competition in both online shopping and streaming video.
body:
The cost of Amazon Prime just went up. But for many of us, the perks are likely still worth it.
Amazon.com Inc. said Thursday that it’s raising the price of its popular delivery and digital-media service to $139 a year from $119 due to “continued expansion of Prime-member benefits” and higher costs for wages and transportation. Customers paying monthly will now pay $2 more at $14.99 a month.
